How to debug

Source: vignettes/debugging.Rmd
debugging.Rmd

Debugging can be done via specification in options(). To check all the options available for orgdata use orgdata:::opt.orgdata. For options for debugging:

  • orgdata.debug
  • orgdata.debug.nrow
  • orgdata.debug.aggregate
  • orgdata.debug.geo

Warning will be given when debugging is active.

debug-warning

orgdata.debug

This is used to display the process flow when running any functions in orgdata. It is useful to know which process creates problems during troubleshoot. To activate:

options(orgdata.debug = TRUE)

orgdata.debug.nrow

To make testing faster for a very big file, you can load only some rows by activating this options. For instance, to load only the first 50 rows use:

options(orgdata.debug.nrow = 50)

orgdata.debug.aggregate

To check what the geographical codes in the original data will or could be aggregated to. For instance the original data that consist of enumeration area codes can be aggregated to municipality or county. Activating this options will add the columns to municipality and county to the data. The different between this options and aggreagate argument in make_file() is that the argument aggregate will cease aggregating keeping the geographical level as in the original data. To use:

options(orgdata.debug.aggregate = TRUE)

orgdata.debug.geo

This option is used to check how the recode of geographical codes from the original data to the current geographical codes. A new columns called rawGEO will be added consisting the geographical codes of the original data. Column GEO is the code to recode rawGEO. If the value is NA in column GEO then no recode will be done for the respective code. The reason is either the codes is still valid for the current year or no recode code available/valid and will be deleted. A warning will be given.

options(orgdata.debug.geo = TRUE)

reset

When activating any options for orgdata, it will be kept active until you actively deactivate it or restart a new R session. You can deactivate it with:

reset_options()

Example output

Here is an example of output after activating orgdata.debug.geo

          rawGEO      GEO  AAR KJONN UTDANN TAB1 TAB2 TAB3 TAB4   ANDRE   ANNEN
     1:  1010102 30010102 2019     0     01    2    8    1    1       1       2
     2:  1010102 30010102 2019     0     01    2    5    1    1       1       3
     3:  1010102 30010102 2019     0     01    1    8    1    1       1       3
     4:  1010102 30010102 2019     0     01    3    8    1    1       3       3
     5:  1010102 30010102 2019     0     02    3    8    2    2      20      20
    ---                                                                        
326790: 50610108       NA 2019     2     02    2    5    1    2      20      20
326791: 50610108       NA 2019     2     02    3    5    1    2      20      20
326792: 50610108       NA 2019     2     02    4    8    1    1      20      20
326793: 50610110       NA 2019     0     03    4    8    1    1      20      20
326794: 50610110       NA 2019     1     03    4    8    1    1      20      20
